conclusion: To determine the heat exchanged, calculate the net work done using the first law of thermodynamics.
Net heat exchanged Q is equal to net work done W.
The process is a closed loop (cycle) on a PV diagram.
Calculate work done in each segment of the cycle and sum them up.
Work done in segment AB is W_AB = P_2 (V_2 - V_1).
Work done in segment BC is W_BC = 0.
Work done in segment CD is W_CD = 0.
Work done in segment DA is W_DA = P_1 (V_2 - V_1).
Net work done W_net = W_AB + W_BC + W_CD + W_DA.
Substitute values to get W_net = P_2 (V_2 - V_1) + P_1 (V_2 - V_1).
